channel.title: Bradley Sansom
channel.description: Hi! I like to make things. I'm a designer, a creator, a developer, and many things besides, from Manchester, UK.

item.title: I'm rebuilding my website
item.description: My newest stuff is on this RSS feed; I'm currently rebuilding my website. My older projects are accessible through my homepage, and will be added here in due course. New stuff will make it on here as well.
item.bs:blurb: Hi, I'm currently in the process of rebuilding my website. This section is the first part of it. This new site includes my most recent projects, but more of my older work as well as personal projects will be added soon.

item.title: Graphical scores
item.description: Having extracted data from the track Voodoo Ray by A Guy Called Gerald, I produced a program that algorithmically generated animated graphical scores by analysing instrumentation data.
item.bs:blurb: Having extracted data from the track Voodoo Ray by A Guy Called Gerald, I produced a program that algorithmically generated animated graphical scores by analysing instrumentation data.

item.title: Interlude series
item.description: Designing a series of three book covers, unified through an interactive chalkboard print finish and a set of geometric patterns. I relished the opportunity to use manual processes including hot foil and debossing to craft my three books.

item.title: Tube map-style road diagrams
item.description: A pair of Tube map style diagrams featuring motorways and trunk roads in the north of England, and a circular map of the road network within Greater Manchester. I made them for my family to use and have also made a version which is available to print and use.

item.title: Terrors
item.description: Collaborating with four students from across the Graphic Design and Fashion Art Direction courses, we directed a fashion shoot inspired by the work of Bruce Asbestos and then curated an interactive digital lookbook.
item.bs:blurb: Collaborating with four students from across the Graphic Design and Fashion Art Direction courses, we directed a fashion shoot inspired by the work of Bruce Asbestos and then curated an interactive digital lookbook.

item.title: Melting typeface
item.description: Faced with a brief to bring new life to the words of a speech by Greta Thunberg, I created a set of fonts which 'melt away', and explored how they could be used across a range of applications.

item.title: dinnerladies article and design
item.description: Set a brief to design a set of spreads about food, I wrote an words and created the pages for a magazine article about the use of food as a comedic device by Victoria Wood to tell stories in her sitcom dinnerladies.

item.title: Wes Anderson magazine design
item.description: Designing two spreads using assigned assets and content, about the films of director Wes Anderson.
item.bs:blurb: Designing two spreads using assigned assets and content, about the films of director Wes Anderson.

item.title: Letterspace
item.description: Creating a letter with a personal connection, telling the story of my unlikely journey to art school.

item.title: Urban/rural found alphabet
item.description: Exploring typography as an introduction to my degree course, through seeing and photographing letterforms in unusual places.
item.bs:blurb: Exploring typography as an introduction to my degree course, through seeing and photographing letterforms in unusual places.

item.title: Broadcast branding
item.description: Producing a comprehensive branding system for a fictional local TV channel, inspired by technical test cards and patterns. I extended the brief to include coded elements incorporating randomisation and graphic generation to blend the worlds of graphics and computing. Later parts of the project focussed on designing branding for local elections news coverage, including set design and 3D rendering.

item.title: My Local Area
item.description: A web app which takes a user's postcode and retrieves data from a range of APIs about their neighbourhood, such as weather, local politicians, council areas, nearby GPs and dentists, and local community groups.
item.bs:blurb: A web app which takes a user's postcode and retrieves data from a range of APIs about their neighbourhood, such as weather, local politicians, council areas, nearby GPs and dentists, and local community groups.

item.title: Wayfinding design
item.description: Producing a set of wayfinding signs for various locations in Bradford city centre with the aim of making it a nicer place for pedestrians. The arrival of the lockdown meant that the project had to be completed using found imagery without being able to visit the sites in person, allowing me to explore 360° panoramic images. I also designed a family of icons representing major public buildings in Bradford which I incorporated on to the signage.

item.title: Skin Kitchen Co branding
item.description: Responding to a live brief to design the brand for a local skincare company, I produced a branding system, set of guidelines, and range of application mock-ups. The owner really liked my designs, saying I "followed the brief really well, it would be a pleasure to work with Bradley in future".

item.title: Election infographic
item.description: In the lead-up to the 2019 general election, I produced an infographic aimed at young first-time voters aiming to explain how Britain's democratic systems work in an informal and engaging manner.

item.title: Pet Shop Boys lyrics Twitter bot
item.description: A (moderately successful) Twitter and Mastodon bot that I run, which posts hourly snippets of lyrics from the back catalogue of 80s synth pop stars the Pet Shop Boys. I host it on my phone, running through the Tasker app and IFTTT. Not affiliated with Pet Shop Boys

item.title: Just a Minute game
item.description: A quick game I made in a couple of hours. Based on the BBC Radio 4 panel show of the same name, where players have to speak for sixty seconds on a subject without hesitation, repetition, or deviation, this web app allows you to play along at home, with between two and four players.
